intro: Gynastrum, commonly known as the "spiny gourd," is a flowering plant belonging to the Cucurbitaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive spiny stems and large, lobed leaves. The plant produces yellowish-orange flowers that give way to elongated, spiny fruits. Gynastrum is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in some cultures.
